summary: This is an email exchange between Assistant United States Attorneys regarding the docketing of a superseding indictment in the case US v. Maxwell. The correspondence confirms the grand jury return and the unsealing of the superseding indictment ahead of an arraignment scheduled for the following week.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the original email on July 8, 2020, who transmits the grand jury return and confirms the superseding indictment is unsealed.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge in the Southern District of New York to whom the grand jury return for US v. Maxwell was wheeled out.

connections.description: The prosecutor is communicating about legal proceedings (grand jury return, indictment) that are under Judge Nathan's jurisdiction.

events.title: Grand Jury Return for US v. Maxwell
events.description: The grand jury return for the case US v. Maxwell is transmitted, and the superseding indictment is confirmed as unsealed.

events.title: Request to Docket Superseding Indictment
events.description: A prosecutor requests that the superseding indictment be docketed on ECF to provide notice to the Court and the defendant before the upcoming arraignment.

keyFacts: A superseding indictment in the case US v. Maxwell (S1 20 Cr. 330) was returned by a grand jury and unsealed.
The indictment needed to be docketed on ECF to provide formal notice to the Court and the defendant before an arraignment scheduled for the week of July 13, 2020.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judge in the Southern District of New York for this matter.
No warrants were issued in connection with this superseding indictment.
